review.reviewBody:
I bought this coat for a 10-day trip to the Azores. It rained nearly every day, and didn't stop me for a second! The Torrentshell kept me dry and comfortable, even on a 7 hour climb of Mt. Pico with rain blowing from all directions.

- I love the blue color, it looks great.
- the jacket, like all raincoats can be a little warm in warm weather. It is an effective windbreaker and the pit zips help- I was pretty comfortable wearing it with a T-shirt underneath in 65 degree weather.
- initially the jacket is a bit stiff and crinkly from the factory, but after a few uses and packing/unpacking it loosens up nicely.
- zippers and pulls are great quality.
-lightweight and packable in a pocket.
-I am 6'1", 190lbs and the Large leaves plenty of room for layering without looking baggy.

I LOVED having this jacket and highly recommend it.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my first AT trip. But I live in western NC and plans changed. I used the jacket to travel throughout the area and assit people in need. The jacket took all of the abuse that I have it and it keep me protected from some very nasty weathet.
review.name: Great product from Patagonia

review.reviewBody: Excellent product: sturdy, well-made, effective, smooth-operating protected zippers, large zipped armpit openings, ample Velcro to secure jacket around wrists, ample hood.  My only complaints are that there aren’t any inner pockets, and the durable, high-quality material is on the ‘crunchy’ side, so to speak, and is therefore fairly noisy when putting on, taking off, and moving around.
review.name: Excellent rain-protection and quality

review.reviewBody:
I just spent 14 days in Alaska and it rained pretty much every day. This jacket definitely kept me dry and it kept the wind out but you’ll want to layer because it won’t really keep you warm. 

The only negative is that it sounds like you’re wearing a Doritos bag. It’s really noisy. Other than that, it’s great!
review.name: Nice raincoat

review.reviewBody: I will never buy from Backcountry again because of their return policy.
review.name: DON’T BUY FROM BACKCOUNTRY
comment: We truly value your feedback and are committed to using it to improve. Check your email – we've reached out to address this.

review.reviewBody: It was a nice rain jacket. It ran true to size. The zipper flap seems to be backwards. It would work better for a left-handed person. It was hard to zip from the right side. I returned for that reason.
review.name: Zipper flap for lefties

review.reviewBody: Bought this a few weeks ago...a little off season so the sale price was a bonus! Strong, durable, feels like it will last forever. I bought a size up for room for a warmth layer underneath and it's just right. Ohio turned warm and rainy in January so I've had use for it...great buy.
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody:
Hiked 11 miles in a snow shower PNW day recently and this jacket kept me dry during the entire hike, and its arm vents really helped to flow heat out.
I am 5'6" and small size fits well even have enough space for a fleece layer underneath
review.name: A solid backpacking rain jacket

review.reviewBody:
These overshoes ard way to big 
Can not be worn over cycli g shoes 
May work for work boots ????
review.name: Gore C3 Goretex overshoe way to big

review.reviewBody: Well, like other said, it is very baggy and large.
review.name: The other reviews are right

review.reviewBody: Agree 100% with previous reviews about oversizing. I too am a 9.5 US / 43 Euro and the recommended size is way too big. This means the very thin vertical strip of Velcro at the back of the cover doesn’t connect with its counterpart, making closure difficult. The material looks like good quality but definitely size down if you want to buy.
review.name: Baggy and poor closure

review.reviewBody: I went by the size chart, and ordered a 9.0-10.5.( I take a 9.5 shoe).  They are so big, its like wearing trash bags on your feet. Horribly oversized.  Unfortunately, I waited too long to try them on to exchange them or get a refund. I am not sure how Gore Wear can be so off on a size chart.
review.name: Poor Fit, Runs Large

review.reviewBody:
Ordered these for the imminent rainy rides here in Seattle, after having worn through my Seal Skinz. Saw the reviews about the poor velcro closure, but thought "Ah well, as long as I strap my rain pant cuff down over top of them..."
Opened the package today, pulled them on over my mtb/commuter bike shoes... "Wow, these really are bad." I knew I would be returning them seconds after that.
Because of the loose-fitting Gore-Tex fabric as well as the awkwardly massive velcro at dead center on the back, the bottom edges hang over and on the treads of my shoes. Or, they were hanging over on one side and felt impossible to even out. Obviously, this is likely because this shoes cover does not fit snug over your shoes and they're not made to. However...
The worst part is the two huge pieces of velcro at the back... You know that experience of trying to hold down two edges of wrapping paper, pulled tight with one hand while you fumble for the Scotch tape in the other? This was like that. But now imagine that your wrapping paper has elastic and you're crouching down, trying to hold it down on the back of your lower calf muscle...
Gore, couldn't you have at least made the two sides attached in some way? Maybe right near the bottom? How about one of those water-repelling zippers, then a velcro strap at the top? A line of that sticky, rubber stuff to keep water from coming in at the top?
I am baffled by this design. It just sucks.
review.name: Good concept, real bad follow-through

name: C3 GORE-TEX Overshoe

review.reviewBody: If you?re a runner you will appreciate these boots.  I ski them with voile objectives and small 3/4 length race skins.   Not what i want for skiing bumps at A Basin or 3? of Sierra Cement but for nimble backcountry missions this is the one.  Pretty much jogged up to Helen Lake on Shasta for my first outing and they were plenty of boot and ski for some ice, some corn and some mixed.
review.name: Light and fast

review.reviewBody: I live in Alaska and this boot has become my daily driver for touring. The boot is pretty warm and has great heat moldable line but when it gets below 10 degr. F I put toe warmers in the boot.  I have probably 40 touring days in this boot this year. The boot is very well made and has held up to significant touring abuse. It accepts a crampon nicely. The flex in the boot is amazing and you could almost feel comfortable driving a car in this boot but probably not recommended. The boa system is easily adjusted for proper retention and is easy to release. The Boa takes some getting use to and its easy to over crank it while skinning up and end up with some instep pain. A good boot fitter can help with some padding and adjustments. I like the fact the boa system is hidden or protected under the cuff compared to other boa systems. The sole has little wear after plenty of hiking over rocky summits. If you are looking for a very lightweight but durable touring boot then you are in the right place. So if the boot fits I would tour it.
review.name: Amazing light weight touring boot

review.reviewBody:
These are impressively light--I'm pretty sure I have hiking boots that weight more. I'm just getting started on touring so haven't tested them much on the downhill but they are decently stiff. However, there seems to be a potentially significant design flaw with the placement of the rivets that anchor the boa system over of the forefoot. They dig in right over the knuckle of your big toe. This was obvious right out of the box when I took the liners out during fitting and could already see the imprint of the rivet on the liner. I've temporarily fixed this by placing high density foam over that spot. A boot fitter might be able to do more about this but I doubt they'll want to punch anywhere near the rivet. 

For the money (and from this brand) I expected better.
review.name: Lightweight but beware of rivets
comment: I feel like this boot has been delivered from "on high'.  It is light; it is comfortable; it is easy getting in and out (leave it in the ski mode);  it is fast and easy in transitions;  It has become my favorite boot whether I am backcountry skiing, skinning the ski area or just going downhill..  I have never had a better foot---

name: F1 LT Alpine Touring Boot - 2025

hasVariant.name: Escalante 4 Running Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Escalante 4 Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes. Recently moved from the forward experiences (now the experience flow I believe) and happy I did. Very natural feel and lightweight. I would buy again.
review.name: Lightweight shoe that handles the mileage

review.reviewBody: Great shoes. I've been on a search for shoes that have enough cushion for road running after getting tendinitis from running in too barefoot of a shoe. These feel great but don't feel like I'm running in stilts like the higher stack shoes. Really glad I found these.
review.name: Enough cushion for pavement but not crazy high stack

review.reviewBody: I was so stoked to hear that Altra was finally going back to the original design of the Escalante. I loved this shoe right when I tried it on. Stake height is great, wide feel is amazing. But only 190 miles in to my marathon training and the tread has almost completely worn out and is falling off the sole. This adds significant setbacks to my training now that I have to find a new pair of shoes at such a low mileage. I was so excited for this return to quality to be disappointed with it falling apart.
review.name: I wanted to love these so bad!

review.reviewBody: I wasn't thrilled with any of the women's models/colors in wide width, so I decided to purchase the Men's Escalante 4 (mens regular is equivalent to womens wide width) instead. I wear a 10-10.5 wide in womens and went with the mens size 9 in black/white - perfect fit. Of course I wish the color was a bit more feminine, but at least there was a neutral option! I'm new to the wide toe box, zero drop but I'm absolutely in love with this shoe & hope I never have to go back to traditional tennis shoes. Zero-drop requires some adjustment time - my calves have been BURNING on walks, so I've had to slow it down. FYI I tried Flux footwear first, but they are ridiculously narrow, so I had to return (also beware their return policy). I wear my new altras for walking and strength training primarily, and I plan to wear them when I visit London for 10 days in October. So happy with my purchase overall. One critique is I'd like to see more wide-width options for women.
review.name: Purchased Mens instead of Womens Wide

review.reviewBody: I do a lot of hiking/walking. I have had Altra for years, problem is my right foot had an injury and is wider. The original fit Altra fit perfect. Sadly this original fit seemed to have disappeared. Luckily I found this pair with original fit. Happy customer
review.name: I will definitely purchase original fit Altras again

review.reviewBody: Great for road running. Escalante 3 felt too small on the top of my foot. Went up 1/2 size and this fits perfect. Will buy again.
review.name: Great shoes, perfect for road running.

review.reviewBody: Purchased these through the Altra site. The fit was not correct. Great difficulty reaching a human to initiate return. It's been over 3 weeks and still haven't heard from Altra about shoes arriving.
review.name: I would buy this product again but not directly from Altra

review.reviewBody: This model is way too small. Out of the box, they felt like they fit, but when running, I realized they were too small. My third and fourth toes constantly rub and give me hot spots. My other Altras are the same size and are perfect. Maybe it is a QC issue?
review.name: Size is to small... go up 1/2 a size

review.reviewBody: Great shoe. Best running shoe Altra has put out in a long time. More supportive than the Escalante 2.5 and without the annoying rim in the toe box. Doesn't have all the unnecessary padding of the Escalante 3. Fantastically wide toe box true to the OG Altra design, as compared to some recent models. Might be just a little lower volume in the mid-foot but not in a bad way, and makes the it feel more supportive for a minimalist type shoe. Heel is a bit stiff out of the box and rubbed a little on back of my ankle, but seems like it will break in nicely with a few runs so not worried about it. This is my favorite Escalante model to date. As a long time Altra fan, I find it so frustrating how models change so dramatically from one rendition to the next. Please just leave this one alone!
review.name: Best Escalante yet. Please don't change it!!!

review.reviewBody: Good shoe however, it does not last. I love the feel and the large toe box however after less than two months the heel was worn through, and the shoe lost its support. For the cost not worth it!
review.name: Good shoe, that doesn't last

name: Escalante 4 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of 100% gloves. I also have the brisker which are great. The only issue I’ve had is I have to size up to an XL and I’m usually a large and every other brand such as Fox.
review.name: Great gloves but run small

review.reviewBody: I use these gloves for trials riding love the feel of them and they are comfortable
review.name: 100% Perfect

review.reviewBody: The elastic portion of the glove that snugs around your wrist, is tight.  Had to stretch it out and it fit better.
review.name: Good for the price

review.reviewBody:
These glove run small. I measured my dominant hand several times to ensure proper fit. Most of my other gloves are size large.

The reason I returned these gloves is the neoprene wrist cuff is just too tight. It was too much of a struggle to get the glove on. Once on, the cuff was very constrictive and put too much pressure on my wrist.

If you have a slender hand and wrist, I think this would be a good glove. Seems well put together. Just not for me.
review.name: Wanted to like them but too constrictive

review.reviewBody: True to size. Super lightweight. Well vented. Looks amazing. Good gripping. Can operate cell phone screen with ease. Win, Win!
review.name: 100% Ride Camp mens glove size L

review.reviewBody: I've went through quite a few gloves and these are in my opinion the best. I like the strapless design. Great fit and very durable. I've been using them since the spring, no seams coming apart and no tears. Still fit great.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: I don't like bulky gloves. These are light weight without being flimsy. I use them for DH, enduro and XC riding. Excellent quality and fit. Will def get another pair.
review.name: Light weight and tight fit

review.reviewBody: As other reviewers have commented, these are on the cheap end construction wise. The touchscreen compatibility works but barely and the wrist gaskets have delaminated and shredded after about 15 rides. Seams are holding up fine as is the palm and back material. I use these for warm weather, high exertion XC rides.
review.name: Cheap, but have a purpose.

review.reviewBody: I've actually had an excellent experience with these gloves. I prefer gloves without a velcro cuff or any additional padding in the palm so these are perfect for me. Currently own 4 pairs that I rotate through to keep them smelling more fresh. Highly recommend and find them to be better then other gloves in the same price point.
review.name: Great luck with these gloves

review.reviewBody: This is an absolute terrible glove. So cheaply made. 100% should not be selling this kind of crap. Seriously it's that bad. And sized super small. The material is very low quality.
review.name: Really, really cheap

name: Ridecamp Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I've had 2 pairs of these glasses, and while I love the style and the polarization was excellent, I would not recommend.

Both pairs ended up with a severely cracked glass lens for normal use, and what should be anticipated normal wear and tear. 


This is obviously a defect that Smith does not want to own up to, and I was only offered 1/2 off a new pair the first time and 20% off the second time. 

I've owned expensive polarized sunglasses from a variety of brands that have lasted me years without any similar damage. I would not recommend to anyone since they do not stand behind the quality of their products.
review.name: Great Style but with Defective Glass

review.reviewBody: The fit is good, weight is nice. Chromapop lenses are great. I’m getting used to the side panels but I’m not sure I like the lack of peripheral they create, I’m used to wrap around lenses so I haven’t gotten used the the light being blocked. I’m sure I’ll find the right space for them
review.name: Good, gotta find the right environment

review.reviewBody: I think my favorite feature about the sunglasses is the lens, able to use them on a cloudy day and for full sunlight. Keep my eyes from getting tired during a long day.
review.name: cloudy to sunny

review.reviewBody: I couldn’t be more pleased! The fit is perfect. And the optics are outstanding. I can see better with these than I can through the glasses from my eye doctor. The ordering process was simple and they arrived right when promised.
review.name: I couldn’t be more pleased!

review.reviewBody:
I wear them all day long and my eyes feel great 
at the end of the day
review.name: I wear them all day

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for a pair of new sunglasses and my fishing buddies use Smith. I looked at the options and I had some limitations in choices due to my prescription. I decided to go with the Longfin since they were still curved and the added frame "fins" on the side and top really help block side light. I flyfish for redfish in NE Florida and I'ved used a lot of sunglasses over the year. However, the amount of fish that I can see with the Brown lenses literally blows me away! Great pair of glasses!
review.name: Longfin Rx

review.reviewBody: Excellent sunglasses. Used them on an ocean cruise to Antarctica and was not disappointed. Looked good and had clear lenses.
review.name: Excellent sunglasses. Used them on

review.reviewBody: I do not love these glasses. There is a screw that keeps backing out of one of the arms and they will not stay on my face.
review.name: Not Great

review.reviewBody: Glass lenses better than costa. Polarization is next level. They also fit my face perfect.
review.name: Next level

review.reviewBody: Very nice sunglasses, perfect fit. Smith is the best!
review.name: Very nice sunglasses, perfect fit.

name: Longfin ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

hasVariant.name: Ultralight Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's

hasVariant.name: Ultralight Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ultralight Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Believe or not this is my oldest piece of gear. I’ve hiked over 5000 miles and spent over 350 nights on this pad and my only issue is that the valve has become warped so when the air temperature is warm, it makes it difficult to attach the sack. I’ve never experienced a leak, but I also take great care with my gear and am always careful when opening the valve so as not to break the seal. I can’t seem to resolve the warped valve issue so only now after 5 years and many miles will I look to replace my pad, but I will definitely buy the exact same one.
review.name: Great sleeping mat

review.reviewBody:
Disappointed. 
- Hole - Bought this year and took on the JMT this summer. The pad only made it about 15 days before a hole developed. I was cautious and even had a closed foam pad underneath (both in attempts to prevent a hole and for heat because temps were as low as 20F during the trip). For an $160 pad I expected better quality and durability. I have an old Nemo pad which was significantly cheaper and I held up for over 8 years, will likely go back to that company. 
- Noise is present but not horrible 3/5
- Does inflate quick and easily with the pump sac.
- Kept me warm up to about 45 degrees. (Was NOT warm enough once temps dropped below 40s) 
- Sizing: 5'4" and the 66 in was a perfect length
review.name: Leak on first trip

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great purchase! held air for the entire three nights, sleeping bag didn’t slide around on it. Perfect size and weight for backpacking. Easy to inflate.
review.name: Buy it!

review.reviewBody: Small, comfy, easy to inflate and pack down. Inflating it with the provided sack took me a little bit to figure out, but that could’ve been user error. I got the regular size and it was a little on the short side, but I thought it worked great!
review.name: Loved it

review.reviewBody: I was skeptical thinking it would be noisy but this pad is quiet and comfortable and weighs nothing!
review.name: Best sleeping pad ever!

review.reviewBody: I used this pad for over two years working as a backpacking guide and going on personal trips as well. I used the pad during spring, summer, and fall. I was on a camping trip when the pad got a hole close to the port. Not wanting to spend more money, I decided to give the warranty a try. Shipped the pad off to Boulder, and while they could not repair the pad, they did send me a new one. I had to provide some extra information, but I was so relieved to be able to use the warranty. I am hiking a section of the AT starting this week, and the Sea to Summit people rushed my order to make sure that I got the pad in time. From here on out, I will be a loyal Sea to Summit customer and I can't recommend it enough. Can't wait to see what adventures this new pad and I will experience together.
review.name: Yay!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took this sleeping pad on a winter trip and layered it with a closed cell foam pad. The combo worked well and this pad was very comfortable. It was also quieter than other insulated pads of similar r value. Pump sack system works well, would definitely recommend.
review.name: Quiet and warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pad is a good lightweight option. I usually have hip pain when sleeping on pads, but long as I fill this pad full no hip pain. It isn't very thick, but it is what I expected. It does make some noise when you move throughout the night, but not nearly as bad as other pads.
review.name: Good lightweight pad

review.reviewBody: I have had this pad and have used it for over 600 miles backpacking so far and it has been very reliable. I have had zero issues. It is easy to inflate using the bag that comes with it and deflates as soon as you pull the plug. I have also slept down to teens on it with my quilt and have been warm. The only downside would be it makes some noise when moving about, but that does not bother me at all. I have not used the patch kit that came with it because it has never had a leak or hole, so it is very durable. I purchased the large for more room on the pad, and it still fits in my one person tent. Love this pad and see many people constantly upgrading their gear to be lighter, but I am sticking with this pad as long as it holds true.
review.name: Great pad

review.reviewBody:
Previously borrowed ultralight mat from two other brands and STS wins in 1) debunking the myth about thickness and confirm comfort comes from air spring. In addition, if the air pad 'grid' is vertical, the side size would be compromised.

The mat spec is when moderately inflated. So if you inflate all the way, the size would be smaller than the spec online. I'm 5'7" and definitely need large size after trying both, for both the length and width.

If you use quilt, the noise would be more than a quality sleeping bag, but still much better than the other brand's potato chips effect, because STS insulation is fundamentally different.

Love the color. And plan to pair it with a closed foam one for the winter.

Plus I have been sleeping on it everywhere in the house. Not as comfy as in my bed but pretty decent .
review.name: Favorite sleeping mat

name: Ultralight Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great light for the price point. Good battery life, extremely durable, quality product would expect from Black Diamond.
review.name: Lightweight, durable, great light

review.reviewBody: With bright beams, wide floods and useful color combos I find the Storm 500-R to be a great all around light. USB recharging took away the hassle of needing multiple replacement batteries at once which I would much rather not have to carry and the form factor keeps it close and out of the way of snag hazards.
review.name: Awesome Headlamp

review.reviewBody: Got this headlamp for the red light and rechargeable features. I think having the rechargeable option compared to the battery-powered one is worth the upgrade when you consider the cost of batteries and ease of only needing one power bank for all electronics.
review.name: Got this headlamp for the

review.reviewBody: This is the second Storm headlamp I have bought, one for me and now one for my wife. It's reliable, holds a charge for days, and hasn't broken down, even in tough conditions (rain, snow, fell in the mud, etc). Highly recommend.
review.name: Rechargeable Headlamp

review.reviewBody: I’m so tired of recharging my rechargeable batteries- packing extra for camping in the cold and watching the light dim as I try to get thru a chapter in my latest book. These headlamps are bright - I love the buttons - now separate - for brightness or changing to red- the strap is super comfy with no plastic clips digging into my scalp- best of all I can recharge them in my car as I drive to my next great adventure in Zion or THE Canyon Grand. Super happy - shouldn’t have waited …
review.name: No more batteries!!

review.reviewBody: This thing is great, very bright and last a long time
review.name: Super sweet headlamp

review.reviewBody: First off I’m a hunter. I’m not trail running or walking. I bought this solely to replace an older headlamp. This headlamp is efficient enough to light up some dark woods. I walk in the woods with the green light and it is bright enough to shine out about 50 ft. Beyond that it’s hardly noticeable. The red is good to about 35-40ft out. The blue is more for up close about 6-8 ft, good for blood tracking. Red green and blue are all a flood pattern, the white light is spot or flood. The white light in spot is very impressive. It shines out beyond 100+ ft. Great for picking up eye reflections. The headlamp band is very grippy and the unit as a whole is so lightweight I don’t even notice it. The buttons are easy to press even with gloves on. I feel like the battery indicator light could be a little dimmer but I also understand this isn’t made for hunters so I look past that flaw. Overall I would highly recommend this headlamp if your needing one to light up the woods.
review.name: Great little light, lightweight, impressively bright!

review.reviewBody: I really like this headlamp, the brightness and the improved design of the head strap make it better than any other BD headlamp I've used in the past. Having it as rechargeable is also a great feature.
review.name: Great design improvement

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth Black Diamond headlamp. All I can say is, they keep getting better. They’re easy to use, super bright or super efficient, it’s up to you. The different lighting modes, spot or spread make them super versatile and the lock feature saved the batteries. My earlier ones are AAA powered while my new ones are rechargeable and my preferred companions for backpacking.
review.name: I Love my Black Diamond headlamps!

review.reviewBody: My Storm 500 purchase was an 'upgrade' from an older headlamp. I use it daily for early morning and evening 'walkabouts' with our Lab within her 2. 5 acre invisible fence area. I really appreciate the powerful light for scanning the woods or lighting the path ahead. While I can go days between charges, it is so easy to charge this light. Perhaps Black Diamon should consider selling rechargeable dog collars. So many of us share our outdoor time with our dogs. With the known quality of the headlamps - the dog collars would be quality above the current collars available.
review.name: Storm 500-R

name: Storm 500-R Headlamp

review.reviewBody: Solid hat with a great fit. Perfect for backpacking and shielding the sun with the wide brim
review.name: Great, flat-brimmed hat

review.reviewBody: The hat is exactly like the picture, really cool, but it’s too big. This is made for someone with an extra large head in my opinion. I wore it twice so I can’t send back. Bummed!
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: only had this hat about a month but its definitely down for whatever you throw at it! Well made, Plus stylish and low profile. Just what I need for nice occasion's that I have can be worn thanks black diamond!
review.name: Down for whatever!

review.reviewBody: Walnut color fades really quickly, like in a few days... Would love if they could fix this and I'd buy more! Same hat pictured below:
review.name: Great hat, dye problem

review.reviewBody: Tried it on and sent it back. I’ve got a tiny head and this thing was too big. If you’ve got a normal to large size noggin, it’s gonna be good to sit on your dome. Wish they made a smaller size. Regardless, it’s a well made hat.
review.name: Nice hat, had to return it.

review.reviewBody: Love the hat! Love the low profile BD logo but just wanted to let potential buyers know the Carbon color is actually more navy vs grey which is what it looks like in the pic. Would have gone with black had i known 'carbon' was blue.
review.name: Love the hat but...

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a hat that would help to establish my intermountain west credentials in the Pacific Northwest, and I found it. Having relocated to Seattle from central Idaho to attend graduate school, I wanted a hat that would: Stay on my head, look cool, communicate to the world that I enjoy the mountains and that I ski. This hat does all of those things. 

Already, this hat is getting me noticed.For example, my wife commented on how I "like to wear hats that are not traditional style baseball caps." To which i said. "I know." My wife stated immediately after with "I like your new hat." WIN!
Additionally, I recently went on a sailboat with some strangers, because some people do that here in Seattle, and I caught a couple of people looking at my hat as well. This hat will even stay on your head in windy conditions out on the water and make you look good. Looking good while sailing is either rule number 1 or 2. WIN!

As I am in my mid 30s, I would consider my level of expertise in the hat purchasing/wearing field to be that of a professional. Furthermore, this camper hat is being worn at least once a day, almost every day. Bottomline is, the folks at Black Diamond nailed this one and I recommend it to anyone considering purchasing a hat. Don't be fooled by the name, it's not only for campers. Go and buy one today and see how it gets you noticed.
review.name: Stays on head!

review.reviewBody:
Super comfy and great lookin’ 

Shoulda bought two.
review.name: Good fit and finish

description: Buy the Lake CX332 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CX332 Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake CX332 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a bunion on my left foot which can make buying shoes tricky. I need a fair amount of room in the toe box but not a wide shoe. Some shoes of the same size fit better than others. I have a pair of Lake shoes that are a 44.5 (half size above my regular shoe size) and they work but are tighter than I would like which relegates them to use only on shorter rides. I DO like them and with that in mind I opted for these which I ordered in a full size (45) larger than normal for me. I am still breaking them in but the overall consensus is that they are quite comfortable and have zero issues meeting my needs when putting the hammer down. All in all I am happy.
review.name: A Solid Shoe that Fits my Needs

review.reviewBody:
Bought the Clarino White/White Microfiber color to replace a smaller pair of CX332s. Nothing indicates the shoe is different, but instead of being made out of Lake’s standard high-end kangaroo leather, it’s made out of super cheap leather that squeaks and is very uncomfortable. Realizing I paid $450 for what fits like a Walmart cycling shoe. Stick with the other colors and the shoe is great. 

Competitive Cyclist - the listing for the shoes says kangaroo leather, no matter what color option you pick, this is inaccurate advertising I would like a refund.
review.name: Do not buy the all-white microfiber

review.reviewBody: I do not think any serious rider has ridden such an unventilated shoe, not recently. even previous iterations had a significant mesh cooling area. NOT THESE. Above 15 C, expect to get warm. Really warm. Sweaty. Avove 23 C, scorching hot, and loose 1-3 km hr average vs any top tier competitor. That much... Inner ? black polyester liner. Plastic = heat. 900 kms to date, two summer days, unwearable except maybe fall.
review.name: No ventilation mesh, scorching hot

review.reviewBody: Runs Small. I'm typically a US Men's size 10.5 but went with the 11 (44) to be safe and these fit more like a 10. I even measured my foot and added a half size. Also, the pair I got in the mail was obviously a returned item because they were scuffed up, and one of the BOA closure dials didn't work. I'm going back to Sidi's, that was a lame experience.
review.name: Way small and obviously used

review.reviewBody:
These are the best cycling shoes I have owned.  They are stiff and allow good power transfer.  The two Boa dials allow you to maintain a good fit throughout the ride.  They look great.  

I got the US size 10 (which is also their version of a size 43).  I typically wear a 9.5 M running sneaker but can sometimes require a 9.5 W.  The size 10 in this shoe allowed just enough room for basic orthotic insoles.  At first, I worried that they would be too snug in the toe box.  After a few rides they loosened up and now fit perfectly with regular-to-thin socks.
review.name: Great Shoe

name: CX332 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My second pair. Well constructed shoe, very comfortable, light weight, quick break in.  I walk/hike the Smoky Mountains trails with uneven surfaces, exposed roots and sharp rocks. These shoes perform well in these conditions but I replace the stock insoles with the Merrell Kinetic Elite insoles for better trail isolation. Lot of standing water on the trails and my feet remain dry without any problems. Able to walk all day comfortably.
review.name: Excellent rugged trail shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Checks all the boxes I was looking for. The question remains, how long / well will they last?
review.name: Love them now, but will love them later?
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good fit, but the angles edges of the outside edge of the treads makes them feel wobbly
review.name: Accentor 3 rating

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use these for work in groundskeeping and maintenance of an RV resort. So far they've stood up to the demands in sturdiness and waterproof-ness. I also have a pair of Moab 3 hiking boots, and these seem to be a little lighter and cooler than the Moab. The only advantage I'd give the Moab over the Accentor is a better lacing pattern. It's a bit harder to lace the Accentor up to the right snugness.
review.name: Light and sturdy

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ordered online super fast delivery great product hubby has 4 pairs now!
review.name: Hubby loves his Merrells

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good fit (my size-10.5-can be snug sometimes, these are well sized). Very comfortable and supportive.
review.name: Good buy

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, solid construction, nice support as well.
review.name: Love em

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought the ACCENTOR 3 MID WATERPROOF shoes recently as my first pair of waterproof hiking boots. While they look great, I was hoping for more comfort, as they're intended for hiking. Unfortunately, the interior is stiffer than I expected, and my left foot get tired on walks. If you're prioritizing comfort, I wouldn't recommend these shoes, but they do offer excellent stability.
review.name: Has great look but not comfy

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really comfortable, sturdy and well made. Light weight and impressive grip.
review.name: Not first Merrells, certainly not the last

review.itemreviewed: Accentor 3 Mid WP Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Only just started breaking them in, but so far all good.
review.name: New boots

review.reviewBody:
At this stage, we can climb some V4s at most gyms.
For our 45-degree wall, we actually have 2 sets. 
I bought one set just for giggles, thinking they would be too slippery.
I was wrong. They are surprisingly good.
Both sets came with very consistent quality.
I may just get another set! These are a good mix of jugs, slopers, pinches, and relatively positive crimps (perhaps one to 1.5 pads?).

hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Voyageur Hiking Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've heard about Keen shoes for while and had been tring to get my husband to try them. He has neuropathy and it makes him a little unstable but the wide toe and rugged bottoms make him feel much more in control of where he's walking.
review.name: Husband loves them!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently bought a pair of Voyageur shoes as a replacement pair for some Keen shoes whose soles started to split off after just a few months. (Thanks to Keen for honoring the faulty product and giving me a refund. ) Unfortunately I overlooked the fact that they're just water resistant, not waterproof. But they are very comfortable, and I read from some comments that they do dry quickly, so that's a plus.
review.name: Very comfortable and solid shoe; just wish they were fully waterproof

review.reviewBody:
Outstanding fit, feel and finish right out of the box. My second pair, I just love this shoe! 
Hard to find on the retail trail so I ordered directly from the company. Somewhat nervous because I could not try them on but was very pleased, as they fit exactly as my first pair 
Thank you Keen
review.name: Outstanding fit, feel and finish

review.reviewBody: I literally live in my Keens except when I’m sleeping. The price howevhas me shopping other quality brands like Merrill’s.
review.name: Keen hikers

review.reviewBody:
2nd pair and still loving them. 
Don’t quit making them.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody: Usually use size 9 Keen. This model was size 10 for a comfortable fit
review.name: Usually use size 9 Keen.

review.reviewBody: This is my first hiking shoe (usually ankle boots). I'm very satisfied with the fit and comfort. I would definitely buy again. The color is true to the ad photos.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for every day wear. Comfortable on a hike and downtown.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Keen continues to make the best shoes I've ever had. Look great, and comfortable right out of the box.
review.name: Great shors!

review.reviewBody:
This a nice shoe however the tongue is big and it feels like it does not have enough padding on the bottom and it felt smaller than previous Keen shoes. I wore them for the first time this weekend to a outdoor festival and just walked on pavement for only about a hour and they were not as comfortable as previous models. I have had numerous Keen shoes and my favorite is one that had a lot less padding both on the side and tongue, I don’t remember the name but on the inside of the tongue its listed as ASTM F2892-11
I have been wearing Keens for at least 12 Years.Thank you for the opportunity to express my thoughts on your shoe.
James Garza
review.name: Nice shoe

name: Voyageur Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Wonderful fit and great grip. I am learning to walk again after two foot surgeries and these were a great transition after a post op shoe. I have been a Teva consumer for nearly 40 years.
review.name: Magnificent sandals

review.reviewBody: Used them on a cruise vacation lots of walking so comfortable got them wet and sandy they cleaned up very easily.
review.name: I would buy those again

review.reviewBody: The fact that the color is throughout the sole is dope. I hope Teva continues this trend! The color goes with everything from black to denim to white to bright jewel tone colors. Beige Beige and more Beige!
review.name: Beige is the New Black

review.reviewBody: I was looking to replace Tevas that were multi-color and versatile. Beige, blush, and gray!! Perfect!
review.name: Go with almost anything neutrals

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable for me. Whether I'm hiking or going around doing regular every day things, these are the sandals I am wearing in good weather.
review.name: I will always have a couple pairs of these sandals

review.reviewBody: I only wear Teva sandals in the summer. They're my favorite brand and fit. Not any more. I bought a pair and wore them for three months (daily). I started to have severe back pain that wasn't alleviated by medicine or heat pads. (I exercise regularly, am not over weight, and sleep on a firm mattress.) For a week I tried to determine the source of the pain. Finally it dawned on me...my shoes! I wore a different brand of shoes and the back pain immediately went away. I'm upset my sandal purchase only lasted 3 months, but relieved I don't have back pain. I will never purchase another pair of Teva sandals, they aren't what they used to be.
review.name: Don't buy

review.reviewBody: I got these bc I needed to replace my ancient water sandals and wanted something not ugly for a change, haha. Not only are these cute (the colors are exactly as pictured) they are so much more comfortable than I expected. The straps over your instep and toes are adjustable (the back one is not) which I think is the key here. My foot is a little wide(not so much that I have to wear wide shoes) and my instep is high. The ability to make adjustments at those points was well thought out. The foot bed is super cushy and supports my high arch as well. Wore them 3 days in a row before I had a little discomfort where one strap rubs an old big toe tendon injury. If I can be comfortable in these, anyone can! Even though the website recommended I size up, I stuck with my normal size 7 for a perfect fit
review.name: Comfy and cute

review.reviewBody: I owned a pair of Teva sandals years ago in college, I loved them then and I love them now. I have wore them everyday since I received.
review.name: I can't believe how much I love these sandals

review.reviewBody: These are so cute. I saw them on my sister when i went to visit a few weeks ago and they were great. She said she thought they ran big but we followed alll the directions and ordered mine... they are big. Because of the Velcro closing though, you can kind of get away with it. There's lots of extra space above the toes and below the heel. The other thing is that the soles are bumpy and uncomfortable and when it's hot out they are even worse. I really wanted to love these because they are so cute
review.name: I wanted to love these!

review.reviewBody: The shoes are very comfortable, but I took one star off because the color is pretty different from what is pictured online. I was expecting a more tan/brown colored shoe, the shoes I received were more of a grayish tan (similar to the caribou color of this same sandal).
review.name: Great shoes, wrong color

name: Original Universal Sandal - Women's
Original Universal Sandal - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Carbon Whippet Ski Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carbon Whippet Ski Pole
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Carbon Whippet Ski Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned a Whippet since the 2010-ish period of my hiking the White Mountains. This one is a replacement, but a replacement for a Whippet that retired in full strength and is now resting easily in my front hall. This new iteration with its removable pick is amazing and significantly more comfortable than my old reliable.
review.name: My second Whippet

review.reviewBody: I was a doubter of the detachable whippet head, but am now a believer! I have used this whippet on at least a dozen couloirs this season and it's been very trustworthy, both climbing up and skiing down. What is even better is that I can convert the whippet into a normal ski pole in 30 seconds when I want to ski in-bounds.
review.name: Most Useful Piece of Backcountry Ski Gear!

review.reviewBody: Had some scratches right out of the box. I was able to use it. Nice and light.
review.name: Great Whippet

review.reviewBody: use it all year, from back country skiing to sheep hunting
review.name: great light take it any time in near a glacier

review.reviewBody: The whippet is a fantastic tool for unknown conditions and ridge traverses. I find it very annoying to have to decide on carrying an ice axe in borderline conditions. This is the answer. It is not an extra item and yet it opens up lots of terrain and avoids the classic hoser move of unnecessarily carrying an ice axe for no reason. I've used this on ski missions and plenty of hikes in the alpine.
review.name: Killer Item

review.reviewBody: I haven't used it to self-arrest (good news) but it seems like a good product. Seems well made, not too heavy, and importantly the weight is well balanced. I used it on a 50 mile round trip climb and was happy with it.
review.name: Great so far

review.reviewBody: A great tool to have on any mountaineering adventure, served me well on my trip up Tuckerman's Ravine NH.
review.name: Awesome product

review.reviewBody:
I lost my (non-carbon) Whippet in an accident and needed to replace it. The standard Whippet has been out of stock for several months so I ordered the carbon version without looking at the specs. The carbon version is about 25% more expensive, is almost identical in weight (?!) and has two sections which means it collapses to 40 inches. The standard Whippet has 3 sections and collapses to 25". The extra 15" is a major nuisance/hindrance if you try to rock climb with the Whippet strapped to your pack. The extra length can also be a hassle when traveling.

In summary: if you can, wait until the standard Whippet is in stock. Otherwise you will be paying more for a less functional product.
review.name: Inferior and more expensive than the regular Whippet

review.reviewBody:
This is a great product but I don't understand the design of the carbon version. It only weighs .3 oz less than the aluminum version and it hardly collapses. 

I would suggest going with the standard Whippet Ski Pole with a fully collapsable design given that .3 oz wont do anything for you.
review.name: Great product but I would opt for the aluminum standard Whippet Ski Pole

review.reviewBody: This tool is the ultimate add-on to a mountaineer quiver. it’s a two-in-one for the perfect use. Instead of needing to stash a ski pole, take out a mountaineering axe then switch back-n-forth, this tool does it all.
review.name: Total game changer

name: Carbon Whippet Ski Pole

description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Corus HD Quilt: 32F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Corus HD Quilt: 32F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Corus HD Quilt: 32F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
Good quality, durability, materials, comfort. 650-fill down is more inexpensive. Packs down small. 

Cons: There are smaller and higher fill quilts you can get (800-fill down)
review.name: Best backpacking quilt for the money

review.reviewBody: Warm, great option for pairing with a sleeping pad while minimizing overall bulk. Also a great option for adding extra warmth to another sleeping bag. Overall a great add to any sleep system!
review.name: Warm, great option for pairing

review.reviewBody: Took it down to -5C and felt comfortable with a light merino wool long sleeve on, although I am a warm sleeper
review.name: Warm enough

review.reviewBody: I’ve used the Corus in Scotland England and wales hills in autumn and spring in temperatures just below zero paired with the neo air x as well as the Uber light, and more recently with a z fold Matt as well. This system works so well and is so lightweight and packable that I will never go back to my 3 season bag unless in high mountain winter conditions
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Hi. I own one Parsec and one Corus. Both are fine. Just one problem with Corus. The front pocket is too small for a phone. Surprisingly front pocket on Parsec is ok. It's very hard to understand why. I was really upset when I found it out.
review.name: Pocket too small

review.reviewBody: I have used this quilt for 3 backcountry trips lasting 7 nights each time. The pro’s are its very packable, ultralight, cozy, con’s are the insulation has clumped with big spaces, when using the quilt I find I need to wear my puffy jacket to block drafts on windy nights. For this reason, I am now going to buy a new product. I would not recommend this quilt for fall. For reference. I store my quilt in the larger storage bag, its never been soaked, I’m 5’2 and 130 pounds, I can not sleep on my side and have my back covered while being tucked in the other side. If this quilt was available in a rectangle version I would still consider buying that to replace this one.
review.name: Over all very good.

review.reviewBody: The quilt provides excellent and is much lighter than I thought.
review.name: The quilt provides excellent and

review.reviewBody: Overall good product, only downside is the fact that the down compartments are very big and the down tends to clump up in one place. It leaves spots where there is absolutely no insulation and thats a design flaw. Its either the compartments are too big or there is not enough down for the size of the compartments. Maybe some kind of separators dividing the big compartments in smaller sections would help keep the down distributed evenly.
review.name: only one design flaw

review.reviewBody: very light, very comfortable using it around the house until the weather breaks in the spring! there might be cheaper ones out there, but this one is high quality!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Since I purchased this I have thrown my sleeping bag in the closet and never giving it a second glance! It?s so much lighter and more convenient than any bag I?ve tried to date. I run fairly warm so don?t need a great deal of insulation when I sleep, especially if I am sleeping in my base layers. This complements me perfectly along with my Klymit Static V2 and I have used it in temperatures in the low 30s with no base layers on and was comfortable. This has been my go to sleep system for the last 3 years and over 100 nights in the mountains. If you are the type of person that needs to stay extremely warm when you sleep or runs cold this may not be the system for you, but it is absolutely perfect for me and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to get rid of their bulky sleeping bag to make more room in their pack. It is also worth mentioning that given the nature of the Hydrophobic Down it is important that you use the separate storage sacks and travel sacks to avoid long-term compression. Finally when you unpack it take a moment to fluff the down to restore the R-value, relatively easy but if neglected can drastically wear down the lifespan of the top quilt or result in an uneven heat distribution. All in all a five-star product when used properly with a good inflatable pad and pillow.
review.name: Great change from a bag

name: Corus HD Quilt: 32F Down

description: Buy the Thule AllTrail X 35L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AllTrail X 35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule AllTrail X 35L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I used this pack on a backcountry elk hunt and it’s served its purpose well. The Velcro adjusting back pad is surprisingly strong and never moved or made noise and allowed for really precise adjustment. I hiked a whole spike bull quarter out inside the pack with all my gear and everything held up. 35l seemed to be the perfect size and weight for a full day or two out yet still held a whole elk quarter.
review.name: Sturdy and comfortable for the price

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this bag for a couple of months now, and I must say it is a good design. The size is versatile, it is comfortable and robust, the bottle holders on each side are practical and keep the bottles in place, the main compartment opens deeply for easy access, and it is good looking.

My suggestion for upgrades would be:
- Thicker/more robust zipper for the main compartment; it would avoid the flap to unzipped itself when open for top access.
- The possibility to remove the waist belt; sometime it is not required for day to day, and it is bulky when not used.
- Thumb loops for zippers instead of the little cord wrapped in caoutchouc; it would make it easier to grab, even more with gloves and mitts.
review.name: Great overall backpack

name: AllTrail X 35L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Love the color and looks but I feel like the Bondi 9 is more comfortable for my feet so I'll probably go back to those. Sloghtly too tight so I lossened the strings alot.
review.name: Very nice shoes

review.reviewBody: The toe box is an incredible improvement over the previous generation. The cushion is more... cushiony and offers much more responsiveness. I love the H-Frame for stability, it hugs my foot. I was another pair of these! My only worry is how quickly the outsole will wear out, but overall the shoe is fantastic.
review.name: Best Hoka I've Purchased

review.reviewBody: VERY happy with fit. Watched more than 1yr which Hoka suit me. Found Gaviota men's fit my woman size 11 (men 9.5) so comfortably there's no break in period. On sale and a neutral color to start. BONDI 8 airy blue very popular, hard to find in larger sizes. Bought women 11. Men equivalent size is shorter/wider where women longer tapered more. Have now ordered Stinson 7 in primrose men's bc like the fit and shorter rounded toe. If you're on the fence about buying Hoka, try em. Was a Nike fan for decades & dropped em for their politics. Have many Under Armor, Reebok, & think Hoka maybe "the one" for me from now on. Will watch for sales. Kinda like some of the color combos.
review.name: Gaviota 1st buy has led to BONDI 8 & Stinson 7

review.reviewBody: Roomy and comfortable on long walks and light jogging. My second pair so far.
review.name: Gaviota 5

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, but a little worried about the width. Don't want to "catch an edge" and trip.
review.name: Seems wider than previous Gaviotas

review.reviewBody: Sneakers were bought for my boyfriend as an extra pair. Found these a bit cheaper so purchased them for him. He loves them. Helps the arthritis in his foot.
review.name: Dr recommended

review.reviewBody: The ride and feel of the Graviota 5 is amazing. The wider toe box is wonderful for the hours that I stand on the courts coaching. The support has been the key and it keeps me comfortable on the hard courts.
review.name: This is my second pair of Graviota 5s.

review.reviewBody: Cozy & light. The most pleasant & enjoyable shoe I've had in a very long time.
review.name: Love these shoes. My 2nd pair.

review.reviewBody: Lots of things to like about these shoes. I've become a huge fan of HOKA.
review.name: They're grrrrrrreat!!!!

review.reviewBody: After two knee replacement surgeries, I had a painful time walking. I went to our local athletic shoe store and got fitted for shoes. They recommended these shoes. I could not believe the difference in how my feet didn't hurt when I walked. I love these shoes!
review.name: The only shoe I wear

name: Gaviota 5 Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Saris H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody: Rides great, smooth, nice equipment, I ride along with the app
review.name: Great riding

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody: I had my choice of trainers, and Sarris was the hands-down winner, the quiet ride the H3 smart trainer provides is unparalleled, not to mention how easy it is to use, and how compact it is, with retractable legs and a handy handle to pack it for a weekend at the beach so I won’t miss my miles for the day
review.name: Saris for the Win !!

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody: I used the original hammer and thought the unit was OK. It was loud and the signal would drop frequently, but this H3 has been wonderful.  It quickly syncs up with Zwift and is buttery smooth. I opted for the kit that included the cassette because of supply chain struggles finding a Shimano cassette.  The included cassette is pretty poor.  It's noisy, and just does not have very crisp shifting  Makes your realize how good a Shimano Ultegra cassette really is.  Overall, I am very pleased with this unit and glad I finally made the investment.
review.name: Makes training on Zwift so easy

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody: I moved up from the fluid 2 to this bad boy, I am sure I will be ready for the mountain mayhem next season. I could barely finish the intervals I used to do on the fluid with no problem. Its a great training tool
review.name: Great resistance !!

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody:
I have been using my Hammer 2 for over three years without an issue - almost 8,000 miles.

I'm the only one I know with a Hammer smart trainer and everyone else has had an issue with their trainers at one time or another.  My friends with Wahoo trainers seem to have had really good luck with their customer support.

The Hammer trainer is suppose to have a lifetime warranty.  I hope I never have to use it.
review.name: Hammer 2

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody: Bought this to upgrade to a smart trainer. Love the unit and it's capabilities. Very stable and quiet.
review.name: Very nice trainer

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody: This thng is great. Comes with cassette already on and pretty much ready to go.
review.name: This thing is a monster in a good way

review.itemreviewed: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit
review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a trainer to improve my cycling this winter and wanted to go online with it. The H3 has worked as advertised, and is made in the USA. The chain drive on my road bike is louder than the H3.
Setup was simple and hassle free which is why I selected the bundle. No problems connecting to cycling apps through Windows 10. 
The feature I like the most is terrain matching with a cycling app.  When the H3 changes resistance, it feels seamless. There is no slippage like the tire on trainers. 
Instead of watching the clock to finish my workout, I pay more attention to the virtual road. Staying on my bike indoors for more than a hour is no longer a problem.
review.name: Great Trainer

name: H3 Direct Drive Smart Trainer Connected Kit

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought a few of these shirts at my local scheel's store. I wanted them as workout shirts due to the moisture wicking fabric. I love them so far and the price is hard to beat when other brands charge twice as much for shirts that wear out way faster then anything carhartt puts out.
review.name: Great for working out.

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered three Large Tall force flex relaxed fit shirts.  I got three noticeably different fitting shirts..  One fit as I would expect a large to.  One is larger than an XL I bought a year ago, and one is about the same size as the XL
review.name: Quality Control on Sizing is not good

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shirts have gotten thinner and lighter weight. Purchased this shirt in early 2024 (tag said 2023 version) and the shirt weighs 7.1oz, purchased these shirts again recently (tag says spring 24 version) and the new version weighs 6.5oz. The new fabric is see through against light compared to the old fabric which is not.

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: My boyfriend loves these shirts. He wears them all the time.
review.name: Great shirts!

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Be careful when selecting sizes. These run extremely large compared to other brands. Other than that the shirts are very nice
review.name: Sizing

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband complained constantly about his shirt's always being too short and uncomfortable. Then I bought the Carhartt Force shirts and he's been happy ever since. He's even requested that I get him more of them! They are comfortable, fit great, and very affordable! Thank you Carhartt!!!
review.name: Happy Husband

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Best shirts Carhartt makes in my opinion the relaxed style fit perfectly.
review.name: Great Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like how carhartt fits, loose fitting ... .... ... .... .......
review.name: None

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Will buy these shirts 10 times over. If only they had the Malt color in stock as well as more colors available. This is the only work shirt I wear.

review.itemreviewed: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Carhartt Force Relaxed Fit Short-Sleeve Tee Shirts are great! Carhartt just keeps improving them. They are pretty stain resistant, have a stay dry lining in them that wicks away perspiration, they lengthened the tail so it stays tucked in better and added a bar tack partition in the pocket for a writing instrument - keeps it from getting entangled in eye or sunglasses so the lenses don't get scratched. Color coordinate them and wear one under a button down shirt too. I'm almost always wearing one of these and they come out of the dryer wrinkle free. Highly recommend this shirt.
review.name: Highly recommend this shirt! Great product.

name: Force Relaxed Fit MW Pocket T-Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Marmot Thor Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Thor Tent: 2-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Thor Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looks good so far. I have not used it in the wild but set it up in my attic. Nice quality. Pretty easy to put together. Hopefully it does the trick when it gets put to the test.
review.name: Looks pretty good

review.reviewBody: Rained for 2 days and nights stayed dry inside then the rain iced still stayed dry. There was considerable wind with no folding. In warmer weather the windows prevented condensation. In colder weather with the windows closed I covered the sleeping bag with a wool blanket ,compliments of the u.s. army , to prevent condensation on the sleeping bag. The interior of the tent was considerably warmer than the outside air. The only criticism I have is the noise from the snow skirt flapping around in the the wind not being held down by snow, but not nearly as noisy as the generators from the RV’s camping near me.This tent is a ten. The cup holders are an added plus. The vestibule is roomy enough for packs that stayed dry. Great design with the extra poles.Plenty of room for 1 person.
review.name: Camping the Colorado

review.reviewBody: Bought this tent as a motorcycle tent for my allroad travels five years ago. Used it for one trip. Put it to dry after it and then stored it in a dark storage room. Due to kids did not use it for four years. Took it out…put it up, and the whole outside tent was sticky, because the seams completely degraded. And I know this is something that can happen when you store it wet, but the tent was dry. Bone dry. Just like the rest of the parts. The seams degraded and left all of the glue on the tent. Also, the pole elastics were completely not elastic anymore.
review.name: Great design, poor material
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
 
We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:
 
https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: This is by far the best tent I have ever had.  It not only survived but was hardly phased by 70+ mph straight line winds.  When other tents were collapsing, ripped apart or just blown away this tent hardly moved.  Winter camping is very enjoyable with this tent.  It can be a little warm in 80+ degF, but just add a fan.
review.name: Extreme Wind, Cold & Rain, no problem!

review.reviewBody:
This tent is pretty easy to carry in my backpack and I abosutely love this tent design! 
Poles are hard and solid for keeping tent stady in windy condition. 
Great protection from the rain! Considering how Iceland can get rainy this tent handeled very well, any rain did not get inside to the tent during my campings. 
Tent is spacious for 2 people! I fits my 88L backpack behind my head and some stuff by the side also for another person the same. I think this tent is perfect for 2 people. 
I like the big windows and there is two zipers for vintilations so far I haven't had any issuses with anything sleeping in this tent. Entarence zipers are great and solid.
The base of the tent looks pretty solid I have slept on the rocks next to the glacier and It was fantastic! Also to take poles off the tent after the camping pretty quick and easy. Have slept in few other famous outdoor brands tents that is in the same price range and acutally I loved mine Marmot more than other tent that I've slept in.
review.name: Awesome tent for 2 people

review.reviewBody:
Bought
2015, and only used ca 25 nights in Nordic climat, it is now falling into pieces. The cords in the poles have lost all elasticity, the window has fallen out and the taping is coming out in small flakes.
review.name: Lousy quality

review.reviewBody: I have used this tent for 6 years for winter camping and during shoulder season.  I have always been dry and comfortable. The tent is  spacious for 2 people, which is nice for all the extra gear needed in the winter.  It sets up easily and fairly quickly even with single person doing it. I have an older model with a window in the vestibule, which feel out and one of the fly velcro tie downs also feel off.  Easy fixes, but not appreciated when it started raining.   Overall a bomb proof tent that has seen multiple days of use and I would recommend it to other winter campers.
review.name: Canada cannot destroy it.

review.reviewBody: A little complicated to set up at -20C with snow shoes on but worth the effort.
review.name: Winter Camping in Algonquin Park ... in Feb.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent a month ago. Used it on a  winter camp out in March. Dug out about 18 inches of snow and placed the tent on top of the footprint. Set up was a breeze take down was a breeze. The tent  created a  micro environment which was significantly warmer than the outside tent temperature. Plenty of pocket storage as well as two doors and two vestibules. Tent fly goes to the ground and has fly extensions on which you can pile snow or simply leave alone to block out drafts. This tent is bombproof. I highly recommend it. Worth every penny
review.name: Solid tent!

name: Thor Tent: 2-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody: Out of the bag, the material hugs the body except weirdly at the calf, where the material is very loose.  I wear knickers because it is too cold to wear shorts.  Who wants a draft up their legs?
review.name: Poor calf material/fit

review.reviewBody:
I dont like the 3/4 length basically...these are fine for what they are but theres such a small temperature window where they are what you'd want to have on, which is  Id say roughly  55 degrees to 65 farenheit. But even then you'd be fine with shorts usually.
If I could do over Id just buy another full length knicker to have on hand and then roll them up if necessary....
getting caught wearing these when  chillier than expected  sucks

review.reviewBody: Santini has a nice compressive fit and seem well made. My issues were in inseam length and the seam between leg grippers and main body of short. I have been wearing ALE shorts which have been the only bibs that fit me properly in the length/inseam. I needed new bibs and the ALE Speedfondos were not available so I took a chance with Santini based on reviews. Bibs that have a longer inseam like ALE are very difficult to find, it seems as though bibs sold in the American market are shorter (?). I also prefer a seamless/welded bond between the leg grippers and body of short. My ALE have an imperceptible, sleek, modern, stylish look where the grippers join the body. Santini are nice bibs but not for me.
review.name: Karma Delta bibs

review.reviewBody: i love this shell I scraped it over many rocks and caught it on many tree branches last winter and it still looks brand new. very tough, I think it will last for years
review.name: very durable and very waterproof

review.reviewBody: Took it skiing in Park City. Bomb proof shell, without being noisy like most vortex jackets. Pockets and vents incredibly functional. The red color-way worked great for being noticed on the slopes. Completely water proof- I did not get wet. Extremely wind proof- 30 mph winds and stayed warm.
review.name: Love This Shell!

review.reviewBody:
This coat is fantastic and exactly what I was looking for.  I work at a ski resort and need tough, long lasting gear.  This coat fits my hardworking needs and will last the grueling winters of Michigan’s Upper Peninsula. Great fit and look as well.  I am 5’10” and weigh 175 pounds with an athletic build. Medium fits me just right.
Do it!
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: Well built with fully taped seams and water tight zippers make the a great addition to those powder days on the slopes or rainy day afternoons on the trail.
I love the jacket. Used in resort. Wish it were a little more fitted. Overall very happy
This is a great Gore-Tex shell.  My only dislike is the left handed zipper.
review.name: Light weight, good vents, excellent fit

review.reviewBody: Super light, windproof shell is very functional and stylish. Great for skiing. Lots of useful pockets. Not quite as beefy as expected but my favorite for all but the coldest days
It fits well and has held up to hard use in southeast alaska.
Sleeves a little long but that seems to be the trend with all jackets
review.name: Great Jacket. Love double zipper

review.reviewBody: This is a great ski specific shell. If you are looking for a great high quality jacket for ski touring or prefer a layered system for resort riding look no further. Everything about this jacket is top notch from the materials, to the layout of the pockets and control of the powder skirt. If you are looking for a all round hardshell know that this hardshell does include a non-detchable powder skirt that doesnt have a purpose in summer activities, though with the overall quality of the construction id still consider this jacket for all around use if I was mostly skiing.
review.name: A very high quality, ski specific shell.

name: Haldigrat HS Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great, bought for women’s size 8 boots and they are perfect.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody:
I used these last winter for a trip to Washington and they were great. Hiked about ten miles through two to three feet of snow in the mountains, and they kept my feet and lower legs dry the entire time. They provided significantly more mobility and comfort than the waterproof snowpants I had been using before. Also they are noticeably lighter. 

The only problem I encountered was that the left gaiter's velcro kept coming undone in the middle, so that each time we stopped I had to smooth it out. It wasn't a huge deal at the time, and they never came fully undone. But next time if I was expecting thicker brush or to be moving faster than a simple walk (i.e. a tactical scenario) I would look for something with a zipper.
review.name: Great First Pair of Gaiters

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality and materials.  The fit and design are very well thought out.  Can’t go wrong with this choice.
review.name: Excellent gaiters

review.reviewBody: Buckle pin broke off after only 5 days of use in the middle of a multi day hike.
review.name: Buckle pin broke after 5 days of use

review.reviewBody: Used these on Mt. Whitney at the end of May, and couldn't be happier. Kept the snow out and you won't even notice they're there!
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: I used these gaitors on a recent winter camping trip. They are solid, and do a great job keeping the snow out of my boots. I wish they had replaceable straps - this would make them more serviceable and give them a longer life. The sewn-in strap means they're toast when the strap breaks. Otherwise, these are a well-designed and durable product that I would purchase again.
review.name: OR Crocodile Gaiters

review.reviewBody: OR gear is top quality and these Crocodile gaiters are no exception. And if for some reason you ever have an issue with a product, the warranty process is easy and timely. As long as OR keeps making top notch products with a top notch warranty, I am definitely a customer for life!
review.name: Great products, even better customer service!

review.reviewBody: I like these gaiters for deep snow and tall grasses, they keep my boots dry and free of debris. however, everyone I know has had the buckle for the strap that goes underneath your boot break. outdoor research's warranty process was painless and they took care of me, but I'd like for them to improve the design/materials
review.name: good product, needs improvement

review.reviewBody: Bought for winter forestry work in the mountains. Keep you nice and dry and seem to be rugged enough to not tear in bushwhacking conditions. Getting the perfect fit can be a challenge- getting the hook over your laces while also tightening the bottom strap never seems to line up perfectly.
review.name: Great for forestry field work.

review.reviewBody: I have two pairs of these bought in 2018/2019. I initially bought a pair in large size and, finding them fine for heavy boots but too roomy for lowland boots, another pair in medium. I'm about 5'8" but with fairly long legs. I tend to wear the medium size except with my heaviest boots. Use is predominantly lowland hiking. The good: they're really tough - one pair has just developed a minor tear which I've patched with duct tape, but that's after 5 years of use. I've had no issues with buckles, as has been mentioned by numerous other reviewers. The not so good: the calf clinch can pop open - I have slim calves so there's lots of fabric gathered there, but it's not really a problem as you just clip it back. The flappy tab by the lace hook gets pulled open by vegetation and clogged by mud etc., and then the hook and loop fabric gets destroyed so it no longer sticks. I've cut this off my pairs with no detrimental effects to their effectiveness.
review.name: Reliable and well made - still going strong after 5 years

name: Crocodiles Gaiter

hasVariant.name: Hanko Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Picture Organic Hanko Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
this rain anorak is very sporty looking, almost reminiscent of old school Nautica. The hand is soft and silky. I really wanted to like it, but I'm afraid it's going back. Mainly because there is no side zipper, which is essential in a pull-on jacket that has no stretch. Simply put, getting in and out of it is a hassle. Especially because the cut is on the slimmer/athletic side. Not sure what whoever designed this was thinking. The other design miscue is that the pouch pockets have no zipper, and are angled. This means rain could get in there pretty easily in a downpour. 

If you're considering this one, just know that the on/off is a bit fiddly and could be frustrating in the long term. And, the lack of secure zippered pockets limit its practicality in wetter conditions. Oyher than that, it's a stylish and sporty pullover with attractive color blocking. Fits true to size with an athletic cut.
review.name: Stylish and light but some design flaws

name: Hanko Jacket - Men's
