review.reviewBody: rubber seal negates any friction benefits of the bearings, pedal is always stiff and doesnt rotate freely even after hundreds of miles.
review.name: rubber seal causes lots of friction

review.reviewBody: Installed these on my Why Cycles R+ last year. One pedal squeaked until I put a drop of dry chain lube on the washer. Everything has been great since. I like how big the platform is and how well my Pearl Izumi shoes stick to them. These are great pedals.
review.name: Great Pedals

review.reviewBody:
Nice looking.  Great grip.  Won't stop squeeking.  Pulled off the o ring, checked the flange washer direction, tried with and without pedal washer.... still squeek!!!!  Brutal.

2 stars cuz they still work, and look great.
review.name: Squeeky as %$@&

review.reviewBody: Great product easy install. Super wide platform that makes you feel like standing on the ground. The only thing keeping it away from 5* is that one pedal squeaks. Tried reinstalling using silicone on the face that seats against crank. Thinking maybe graphite? I feel for the price I shouldn?t need to worry about this. Don?t hear when I?m going hard but when I slow down it drives me nuts. If anyone at Backcountry or anyone else has a solution I?m all ears..
review.name: Great pedal would be 5*

review.reviewBody: Only thing keeping from 5 stars is the price is $20 too much. Grinch green fits my bike great!
review.name: Sweet bling pedals

review.reviewBody: The mounting point of the peddle is flared out just past the threads and that flare doesn't allow the peddle to fit large mountain bike shuttle racks.
review.name: These peddles don't fit shuttle racks

review.reviewBody:
Best pedals on the market in my opinion.
Run them on my enduro and e-mtb currently.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: Great pedal with lots of grip. It has a large surface area for added comfort when shredding the gnarl!
review.name: Great Pedal

review.reviewBody: Stripped two sets of SRAM xo1 cranks in less than 3 months. The new version of this pedal is terrible. My old ones are great but will never buy these pedals again.
review.name: Complete Garbage
comment: It clearly states these do not work with sram carbon cranks.
OneUp website states these pedals are not compatible with SRAM carbon cranks due to the counterbore on the crank.  Also, they are not compatible with crank boots without modification.

review.reviewBody: I measured my feet and did so 3x to make sure and the sizing chart is WAY off.  Returned
review.name: Sizing way off

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and finish. I could not be happier with these. Love the dual boa adjustment. For a super stiff carbon sole they are actually quite comfy with no hot spots and the heel holds without slippage or odd fit
review.name: By far the best cycling shoes ever!

review.reviewBody:
First the sizing on their table is wrong... I always wear 11.5/46 or 46.5 and if you look at the table their numbers don't match that. I ordered my 46.5 without paying too much attention to the table and it matches my shimano shoes perfectly (length wise).

Now onto the shoe itself:
- def heavier than any of my other carbon/performance bike shoes
- a bit of extra stack
- Wide enough that now I have 1-2mm extra 
- Looks like an adidas shoe LOL
- Looks WIDE

Now onto the important part: For the first time in long time my feet didn't complain during my long ride; I didn't have to stop or wiggle my toes inside the shoe during the ride and you can't put a price on that. Summer heat is no joke in the South/Mid-West and my feet were swelling up making my rides uncomfortable to the point that I couldn't ride more than 2hrs TOP.

I'm still testing it but unless something goes terrible wrong I am keeping this shoe!!!
review.name: Gotta love some wide cycling shoes

name: CX302 Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mad Rock Lifeguard Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love my Mad Rock Lifeguard belay device.  I first learned belaying with the ATC and thought it ruled for lead belay.  Then, the safety factors of the Gri-gri made it seem like a strong choice, although a bit more challenging to feed lead.  

The Lifeguard changes things by providing all the security and ease of belaying someone top rope, hang-dogging like a gri-gri, but then easily feeds for that quick, long-armed lead climber who needs just the right amount of rope in a hurry.

Definitely a 9 out of 10.  Just because I am not comfortable giving anything a 10.
review.name: Mad Rock Lifeguard

name: Lifeguard Belay Device

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Ultralight Zip Organizer online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Holds more than I expected. Many compartments to keep things organized. Sturdy and wipes clean easily if needed.
review.name: Holds more than I expected.

review.reviewBody: I received this as a replacement for a damaged previous generation zip organizer. The design is mostly unchanged with the exception of the hanging solution. Previously, there was a plastic hook that was large enough to fit on a standard shower or towel rod. The current solution is an adjustable strap that clips around whatever you're hanging the bag from. This would likely be preferred for those using this outdoors since you may be hanging it from tree branches or other non-standard objects. However, since I do most of my travel to hotels and homes and use this bag to store toiletries, this solution has actually been a bit of a pain. I was able to find something to hang the old hook from everywhere I went, but the new strap is difficult to hang to towel rods since they are close to the wall and you need to try to reach your hand in the small gap without being able to see what you're doing, making cliping it in quite difficult. So for me personally, the former bag was a 5 star and this only works as a 4 star, but if the new hanging method suits you better, you can't go wrong with this option!
review.name: New Hanging Solution

name: Ultralight Zip Organizer

review.reviewBody: The tape looks outstanding, and comes with more than enough length to wrap a full round bar practically to the stem.  That’s the end of the positives as I see them.  The bar tape is fine to wrap, though it doesn’t have nearly the same stretch as other high end bar tapes.  The worst part is that it provides essentially no grip at all.  The “art” portion on the drops is incredibly slick when dry to the point of being dangerous and offers only a tiny bit of tack if your hands are barely damp.  With even moderate sweat they go back to oil slick territory.  The black “gecko” portion also does nothing to afford grip or confidence when damp or wet.  I used it for one ride and immediately took it off the bike.  This was the least confidence inspiring tape I’ve ever used.  Thankfully it wasn’t a horribly expensive failed experiment.
review.name: Among The Worst I’ve Used

name: Art Gecko Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: Ordered the wide boot, and glad I did. Have minor bunions, so gives ample room for a comfortable fit for all day wearing. Nice versatile work boot that is also waterproof, so it handles all the elements. Suits my needs! Glad I purchased!
review.name: Waterproof boots

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. I lost count of how many pairs I've gone through over the years. The are good for hiking, working around outside with my horses and fit well under my half chaps, spurs sit on the back nicely.
review.name: My Favorite Work/Horse Boots

review.reviewBody: These are comfortable boots that seem reasonably waterproof and durable. My issue however is that I’m not sure what terrain they are being named after  definitely not anywhere in the Rocky Mtns where one might expect to wear hiking boots. Living in Northern Idaho I was skeptical when I received these boots ss a gift as the tread could only be considered aggressive on a basketball court. When I actually took them hiking I found they are not good at maintaining traction on steep hiking.surfaces. As I mentioned, they are comfortable and well made, but are probably best served for hiking on concrete.
review.name: Not exactly for hiking
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this boot.  We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.  Please contact info@ariat.com or give us a call at 1-877-702-7428  if you need further assistance in this matter.

review.reviewBody: I previously purchased a pair of them and believe it is a really good product, so much that I purchased a second pair as a replacement for the first set.
review.name: Good Qualitiy Product worth a second pair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband has a lot of foot pain. We had bought him another brand work boot and his foot pain was getting worse. He tried this boot and said they felt much better and wants me to order him another pair.
review.name: comfort

review.reviewBody: Fit great,look good, my feet stay dry and don't hurt.yes,  Enter sweepstakes please. Would love to win and order more boots.
review.name: My new atiat boots.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for Alaskan trip.  Wore in rains several days in a row, kept feet dry and warm.  Great fit and looks good to boot!
review.name: Warm and dry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable with great arch support. Wife even bought a pair.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great boot, have bought for several years and use for a all around, work, ride and hike boot
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody:
This is my second hat from Steven and a really loveit , 
I get it in size M and they are perfect
review.name: Loved

review.reviewBody: Lovely hat and affordable for Stetson. I used the Stetson size chart and had my wife measure my head twice. According to chart, I should be right in the middle of size large. I was skeptical but reasoned that since it’s a unisex hat, maybe it runs a bit smaller than typical small, medium, large. Unfortunately it was way too big. Backcountry doesn’t have a medium size for whatever reason so I had to return.
review.name: Great Hat, Sizing Chart Not Correct

review.reviewBody:
I opted for the XL size in light brown (mushroom) so that I would have enough room back-to-front for my oval shaped head.  This meant that it was a bit loose on the sides but that was simple to fix. I just inserted the correct width of hat size reducer foam in the sides (purchased separately). Since the hat has a comfortable band on the inside the foam can be fastened directly to the inside of the hat and the band then folded back over - making my customization discreet and unlikely to move.

I have many hats and this one gets the most frequent use. It looks good and serves the function of sheltering from the sun well. The brim was wider than I expected but looking at the pictures on the website again I don't know how I expected the brim to be any smaller than it truly is! Anyway, it's not a problem. The brim is the best size, that is at least what my brain has adjusted to now.
review.name: High-quality and stylish

name: Bozeman Hat

hasVariant.name: Thule Levels
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Thule Levels online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got these as a fan of the brand and because they’re not brightly colored, work great and appreciate the included storage bag.
review.name: Sturdy basic levelers

review.reviewBody: Just found out today that these levelers can do recovery work that recovery boards cannot do.  Not that the situation is for snow, sand, or mud, but for a car stuck by a large rock after driving over it at a fast food drive-thru.  I first just drove past, thinking that a tow service will do, but then it clicked, I can use the leveler for the car to back up to the rock.  It worked perfectly!
review.name: More than a leveler!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a van that I travel in a lot. With these levelers I have been able to make sure that I am getting a good nights rest. I don't have to worry about sleeping with my head too high or too low, these help me make the van nice and leveled.
review.name: Perfect way to level your car

review.reviewBody: Took these on our first southern trek from MT to AZ stopping at several organized campsites and some primitive. In all different substrates they were so easy to use the levelers to make a perfect sleeping arrangement
review.name: Light weight and easy to use

review.reviewBody: Great quality & solid construction wish they were higher
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: These levelers are world class. Generally Thule equipment is pretty expensive, these might be the most reasonably priced Thule product in the history of earth.  They are well constructed. The way they fit together and the storage bag make for an easily stowable quality way to level your vehicle.
review.name: These things are great!

review.reviewBody: I have just received this product yesterday, can't wait to try them.  I was totally surprised when I noticed a carrying bag with this item they fit perfect.
review.name: Great Product

name: Thule Levels

description: Buy the Ocun Lite Crack Glove online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lite Crack Glove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ocun Lite Crack Glove online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm on my third or fourth pair of Ocun Lite Crack Gloves now.  These gloves give great protection to the backs of my hands when working powerful hand jams in the gym without getting in my way for some thinner jams.  I'm using them to work a 20 ft. roof hand crack 3x a week without destroying my skin.  Great rubber that bites about as well as good tape gloves to help you ease into projects.  They won't help you much with fist jams, but tape can help with that.  They could be a bit thinner if anything now that I've got some practice with climbing hand cracks.  They make a certain "paddle hands" jam into a comfortable hand jam in the gym.  The loop on the wrist closure keeps failing before the rubber wears through, but I probably get 1500-2000 ft. of crack climbing before I have to replace them.
review.name: Hand Jam Training Protection

review.reviewBody:
The rubber on these gloves is unbelievably sticky. It really helps secure the jams on slippery granite cracks. Also, they hold up really well. I have used a lot of different crack gloves and they all wear out after a few months, not the Ocuns! 

Definitely worth the money.
review.name: So sticky!

review.reviewBody:
I will wear ocun gloves for as long as I climb. They’re the most comfortable, durable, and functional crack gloves. The lite version is excellent - while the older versions had thicker rubber, these have thinner rubber and minimal padding behind the knuckles for fitting in thinner hands cracks.

I actually keep an old pair for bigger hand cracks/cupped hands, and the lite pair of I know I’ll be climbing thin hands. Can’t overstate how valuable these have been to me - from Nose in a Day missions to sharp vedauwoo single pitch. I love my Ocun Jammies.

PS. If you bought the old ones, the lite runs a little smaller - I was a small in the old black leather ones, and I’m a medium in the new red leather ones.
review.name: My Forever Jammies

review.reviewBody:
These are the perfect crack gloves! The original Ocun gloves were a bit too thick, but I loved how grippy the rubber was. I've tried all the other gloves on the market - thinner gloves such as the OR and BD ones don't have quite as much grip as I wanted. Finally, the Ocun Lite came out and it is the goldilocks of crack gloves - they are a bit thinner while keeping the awesome Ocun rubber! The finger loops are also a bit looser than the original Ocuns, so they are more comfortable.

I'd size them the same way you size your original Ocun gloves.

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Infinity Shell Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well designed & functional-.Bought these bib shells  in size medium to replace my insulated ski pants. I  am 5’9” 155 lbs. I prefer these over insulated pants b/c I ski hard & run hot. Great mobility & thick (but not too stiff) material. I wore a thin & thick base layer down to 0 degrees Fahrenheit (I usually leaned towards the lighter base layer b/c the pants are windproof. I like my gear a little loose vs tight & these do the job once I got the suspenders adjusted to my torso/height.there is a zipper in the right place (for #1)-and that’s important so you don’t have to take your coat off when nature calls.Cargo pockets on legs function well for light items (such as goggle covers & lift passes).The chest pocket could hold a beacon but I usually just harness the beacon.Got a few props in the lift line (good for style points). Definitely water proof & leg vents (on outside of leg) dump the heat. I would recommend these bib pants to the hard charging, powder hound. Hope this helps.
review.name: Great Bib from Helly Hansen

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Infinity Shell Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These fit really tight just below the abdomen. The legs are too baggy, the top is a little too loose. I have average proportions, a little larger legs than average from powerlifting hobby, and these are still too baggy in the legs. 

Then with the top of the bibs, it is hard to get in a puffy and have it still be comfortable. The fabric seems good and I like the neutral color that works with other gear. Will have to update my review after ski season.
review.name: Really odd fit

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Infinity Shell Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The materials and workmanship on this piece are top notch, what you would expect from HH. The pocket layout is good however, the fit is atrocious. I have had bibs from Spyder, EMS, Marmot and ??? brands and the HH Ridge has the worst fit. It?s akin to wearing an ill- fitting sack. Way to baggy below the waist and tight above.  The side-zip entry is also odd and  not user friendly.  I?m not sure what kind of body would be well suited for these bibs, mine, 5?8? 31 inch waist, 40 inch chest, was not and they were returned.
review.name: Great finish horrible fit

name: Ridge Infinity Shell Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable when carrying and easy to pull when a break is needed. Will be our go to luggage on our 4 week trip to Italy in 2025.
review.name: Comfortable when carrying and easy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] this pack is perfect for longer travels. the wheels roll beautifully & the backpack conversion is perfect for hauling anywhere rolling is not possible. i look forward to exploring the world with this well made wheeled travel pack. thanks osprey.
review.name: this pack is perfect for

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this bag. It's my favorite piece of luggage I've ever owned. Clothes fit inside in the center section and cinch down tightly. This leaves tons and tons of space around the clothes for small underwear bags, toiletry bags, shoes, etc. The top pocket is also huge which works great for having some items in a separate compartment. I feel like the things others are not liking about the bag are what works best for me. I'm amazed how much I can fit into this bag vs a similar-sized plain rectangular bag. Now I'd like to get the smaller one as well!
review.name: Best bag ever!

review.reviewBody:
Wow, I am surprised to see the negative reviews on this bag. I have backpacked 26 countries and approximately 10 or so with this bag. I did a ton of researching this bag before purchasing it and I chose this bag for multiple reasons. 

This bag is awesome for my style of backpacking because it opens like a suitcase, it has straps to carry it on your shoulders, you can hide the straps during transiting and it has the ability to be wheeled (HUGE). I have given a lot of thought into this bag, I will say it's biggest feature is the ability for it to roll it through airports and other flat destinations (like subways). Having to sling it on, especially when its a packed subway and loaded with 20kg, then bump someone in the process is a pain in the butt IMO. When you can easily wheel it... 

For my type of backpacking, I am usually going in an Uber/taxi to or from the airport or hotel. Out of 26 countries I can honestly say I have never walked far (max. ever approx. 5km) with this "big" backpacking bag. If I'm doing a day trip of a couple day hike, I am taking either my daybag or medium sized bag.

Yea the downsides of having the expandable bar in the middle of the bag sucks and makes it awkward, but it is a give/take relationship here and you gotta determine what is most important/convienent for you. I have never had issues with it and I can contour my clothes of compression bags over it.

I'll be buying another for my girlfriend as her current bag (without wheels) is just too much for her and makes things more difficult than they should be.
review.name: Does the Job

review.reviewBody: The telescoping handle and backpack structure protrudes inside of the bag and creates a curved surface. This prevents being able to pack standard flat compression bags and the like. Being able to attach the daylight backpack seems like a nice feature but none of the airlines allowed it to be checked as such. I used this for 3 weeks in Thailand. Needless to say it was extremely disappointing having to adapt how I packed for such a trip.
review.name: Disappointing and expensive

review.reviewBody: The pack is a big disappointment. It has literally three dimension pyramid inside which is impossible to pack around it . it is part of the frame/telescoping handle but the design has fail to make a inside flat which is important to pack anything. The images and photos about the design do not show the inside pyramid in the bottom which should be flat for packing. To add to the problem the Osprey FairPoint travel pack that suppose to be attach to the pack was not accepted by the airlines. Evetime they made me check the travel daypack
review.name: No I will never even consider buying again.

name: Fairview Wheeled 65L Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: I wore this helmet for two full days at trestle bike park and not once did I feel hot or uncomfortable. I have a larger head and get headaches easily from helmets that over compress but despite this being a snug fit I experienced zero discomfort. And you honestly cannot beat the price
review.name: Comfortable and Afordable

review.reviewBody: Love this thing. Ordered one, crashed hard in it, and it saved my life. This thing has incredible protection at a great price. Sure, it isn't as fancy or well ventilated as a helmet at twice the price of this one, but it is pretty dang close. Very well ventilated for the price. It is also very nice and lightweight, and VERY comfortable. I ordered another one because I loved it so much. Could not recommend enough for anyone looking for a well priced, very protective, and well made DH rated full-face helmet.
review.name: Great helmet at a great price

review.itemreviewed: 20oz Wide Mouth Flex Cap 2.0 Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's been awhile since I bought a new Hydroflask. First, I don't know if this is a new thing but I'm finding it very difficult unscrewing the lid, it is very tight. Then one day, I laid it on it's side on the passenger side in my car, only to discover that it had leaked all over. Thankfully it was just water but I was really disappointed. I never had this problem before. I don't know if it's a defect or if this is just the way they are now. In the past, I bought the 18oz. I thought I was buying the same thing but the 20oz is taller than the 18oz and doesn't fit under the water dispenser in the refrigerator. I'm really not loving my new Hydroflask. I've always been satisfied in the past.
review.name: Disappointed
